author: senh
title: In Transit: Hiking and Biking in Tasmania
text: BING NEWS: Venture to East Bay parks by transit and bicycle With the first rainfalls, the East Bay hills start to turn green, and the cooler weather is perfect for hiking and mountain biking. There’s no need to start up the car to access these amazing parks. Many are within an easy bike ride from a BART station ... 11/12/2014 - 7:47 am | View Link New $1.4 million DeLand transit center opens The DeLand Intermodal Transportation Facility ... The 3.5-acre site is also connected to the DeLand Greenway, a hiking and biking trail along Alabama Avenue, and is located near Melching Field at Conrad Park, as well as Spec Martin Memorial Stadium ... 02/7/2014 - 8:29 am | View Link Bridge spans 2 states' economic, transit interests It replaces the old Stillwater Lift Bridge which will become part of a hiking and biking trail. The new four-lane span links the two states along Highway 36. 05/28/2013 - 3:19 am | View Link Best reuse of abandoned freight rail corridors – public transit, anyone? In the group that I participated in, one of the suggestions made was to convert an active rail line running on a basically northwest-southeast alignment through the city to a recreational (hiking-biking) trail. In the Nov. 2012 op-ed, my response to this ... 05/1/2013 - 1:00 pm | View Link Jackson County executive wants to ride transit’s momentum Topping it all off are additional hiking and biking paths, including a long dreamed of link that would extend the statewide Katy Trail all the way to the sports complex.
